testQA.question: Discuss briefly the key decisions which fall within the scope of financial strategy

A Ltd. is considering a Rs.50 crores 3-year interest rate swap. The company is interested in borrowing at a floating rate; however, due to its good credit rating, it has a comparative advantage over lower-rated companies in the fixed-rate market. It can borrow at a fixed rate of 6.25% or a floating rate MIBOR+0.75%. \n Presently, MIBOR is 5.25% but is expected to change in 6 months due to the political situation in the country. X Ltd., an intermediary bank, agreed to arrange a swap. The bank will offset the swap risk with a counterparty (B. Ltd.), a comparatively lower credit-rated company, which could borrow at a fixed rate of 7.25% and a floating rate of MIBOR + 1.25%. X Ltd. would charge Rs. 12,00,000 per year as its fee from each party. Mr. Fin, the CFO of A Ltd., desires that A Ltd. should receive 60% of any arbitrage saving (before payment of fees) from the swap as A Ltd. enjoys a high credit rating. Any fees paid to the bank are tax allowable. The applicable tax rate is 30%. You are required to: \n (a) Evaluate whether the proposal is beneficial for both parties or not. 
(b) Assuming that MIBOR was to increase to 5.75% immediately after the political crisis over and shall remain constant for the period of the swap, evaluate the present value of savings from the swap for A Ltd., assuming that interest payments are made semi-annually in arrears.
